intro: Buchnera attenuata, commonly known as the slender buchnera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Buchnera attenuata is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
